key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to raw material shortages and energy price volatility
Intense competition from global players like International Paper and Mondi
Merger integration risks with WestRock, including operational disruptions and cultural challenges
controversies: Scrutiny over resource consumption, waste management, and carbon emissions
Potential operational disruptions from the WestRock merger
environmental_issues: High resource consumption and carbon emissions despite sustainability initiatives
Regulatory compliance with evolving environmental standards
social_issues: Potential cultural challenges during the merger with WestRock
governance_issues: Complex financial reporting post-merger with WestRock

sources.title: Smurfit Kappa accelerates CO2 emissions reduction in 2020
sources.snippet: Compared with 2019, Smurfit Kappa made significant progress in reducing its fossil CO2 emission intensity. The Group is the first in its industry to have announced targeting at least net zero emissions by 2050 and, compared to its baseline year 2005, it reduced its emissions intensity by 37.3% by the end of 2020.
